tag.name: cfslider
tag.help: Puts a slider control, for selecting a numeric value from a range, in a ColdFusion form. The slider moves over the slider groove. As the user moves the slider, the current value displays. Used within a cfform tag. Not supported with Flash forms.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for cfslider control.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to display with control. For example, "Volume" This displays: "Volume %value%" To reference the value, use "%value%". If %% is omitted, slider value displays directly after label.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Numeric slider range values. Separate values with a comma.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Unsigned integer. Defines slider scale, within range. For example: if range = "0,1000" and scale = "100", the display values are: 0, 100, 200, 300, ... Signed and unsigned integers in ColdFusion are in the range -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Starting slider setting. Must be within the range values.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input; in this case, a change to the default slider value. Specify only the function name.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails. Specify only the function name.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Slider control height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Slider control width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical spacing above and below slider, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of slider, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment of slider: * top * left * bottom * baseline * texttop * absbottom * middle * absmiddle * right

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows

parameter.name: vertical
parameter.help: Yes: Renders slider in browser vertically. You must set width and height attributes; ColdFusion does not automatically swap width and height values. No: Renders slider horizontally.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in italics No: it does not

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in bold No: it does not

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!
